backend/main.mo: Defines group, stage, and round‑robin stage config maps with methods to add groups/stages and create per‑stage advancement rules.
backend/migration.mo: Migrates old actor data into a new structure containing only group names, stage names, and empty round‑robin configs.
feature_evidence.json: Lists feature‑to‑file mappings showing where advancement logic, qualification, validation, and knockout behavior were implemented.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries of major frontend files describing their roles in tournament generation, UI, state, and knockout logic.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base styles defining OKLCH color variables for light and dark themes with global background and border rules.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point that loads the React app via main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Selects and renders the current tournament view (setup, schedule, knockout) and mounts global toasts.
frontend/src/components/AdvancementConfi: UI dialog for configuring per‑stage winner and runner‑up advancement destinations and saving them to the store.
frontend/src/components/AppLayout.tsx: Shared layout wrapper providing page structure and a footer with Caffeine attribution.
frontend/src/components/KnockoutPairingE: React UI for configuring knockout pairing mode and manually assigning teams to first-round knockout matches.
frontend/src/components/MatchDateTimeEdi: Small editor component allowing inline date/time updates for a match with validation.
frontend/src/components/Stage2GroupAssig: Displays how teams advance between round‑robin stages based on advancement configs.
frontend/src/features/tournament/generat: Generates round‑robin stages, distributes teams into groups, and determines team advancement between stages.
frontend/src/features/tournament/groupNa: Generates alphabetical group names, supporting single letters and extended pairs like AA/AB.
frontend/src/features/tournament/knockou: Builds knockout match brackets using qualified teams, pairing mode, and fixture assignments.
frontend/src/features/tournament/matchCo: Computes total match counts for round‑robin and knockout phases with per‑stage breakdowns.
frontend/src/features/tournament/qualifi: Computes which teams qualify for knockout stages and counts how many qualify based on advancement rules.
frontend/src/features/tournament/roundRo: Generates round-robin match pairings for all unique team combinations within a group.
frontend/src/features/tournament/types.t: Defines all core tournament-related types including teams, groups, matches, stages, advancement rules, and knockout config.
frontend/src/features/tournament/useTour: Zustand store managing tournament state, advancement and knockout configs, and generation actions.
frontend/src/features/tournament/validat: Validation helpers for team counts, round configs, advancement rules, dates, times, and displaying advancement labels.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages a backend actor tied to Internet Identity and refreshes dependent queries when it changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides Internet Identity authentication context, login handling, and persistent identity loading.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Placeholder module for future backend-related query utilities.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind-based global styles defining theme variables for light and dark modes.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point setting up React, query client, identity provider, and global styles.
frontend/src/pages/KnockoutPage.tsx: Displays and manages knockout-stage rounds, match groupings, qualified team counts, and compatibility validation errors.
frontend/src/pages/StageSchedulePage.tsx: Shows round-robin stages with expandable groups and allows editing match date/time per group.
frontend/src/pages/TournamentSetupPage.t: Handles tournament configuration including team count, round settings, advancement rules, validation, and triggering tournament generation.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Configures TailwindCSS theme, colors, typography, animations, and plugin usage for the frontend.
project_state.json: Describes the project’s current architecture, requirements, known issues, and feature-state metadata.
